result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl E. Vines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court may grant expungement request if Defendant completes probation successfully, renews request and proves to the court that he is bettering his life.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  Perform 40 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with co-actors Antonio M or Gerald G, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms or ammunition.

supervisions.notes: To be paid during the term of probation in Count 1.

Credit for 120 days - TIME SERVED.
Consecutive to Count 1 - no credit applied to Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl E. Vines

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Patton.   Clerk HMcBride. DE enters guilty plea to cts 1 and 2.  Court finds DE guilty of cts 1 and 2.   Ct 1 - court imposes and stays 6 months jail and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions;  ct 2 - court imposes 120 days jail with credit for 120 days time served (no credit applied to ct 1 -  consecutive to ct 1); costs applied;   DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court.   Expungement request. State objects.   Court may grant request if DE completes probation successfully, renews request and proves to court that he is bettering his life. Hearing will be scheduled and court may grant request if satisfied.    Appeal rights given.

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney David Patton in court with Defendant Carl E. Vines who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  DE has no conflict with proceeding before Judge Gabriele today.  Case is not resolved and remains on for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm as Atty Patton unavailable at 1:30 PM.
Court is no longer available in the AM on 7/13/22 so hearing moved to 1:40 PM on 7/13/22 and confirmed with Atty Patton

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms,  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Gerald G IV, Antonio M, Thomas S

Minutes:  Judge Kluka acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Smathers appeared for the State.  Atty David Patton appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft's appearance waived for this hrg.  Defense filed a bond motion.  State objects.  Arguments heard.  Court will amend bond down to $5,000 cash.  All conditions remain the same.  FPT 7/13/22 @ 9:40am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
